Summary: Double Size of Avg Star and 4 Times Brighter Then Avg Star
divs: Sighting DetailsI was sitting out front of my house having a cigarette. The shooting star caught my eye, I stood up real fast to try to get a view. A few seconds (Aprox. 2 secs) in the exact location of what I thought was a shooting star poped back on to a white light that was aprox. twice the size of a avg star and four times brighter. The first thought that came to my mind of how it was moving was like a fire fly. The object looked the same distance as the stars because it was so far away. The object made a complete circle patter on the sky which let me know it could not be a shooting star and then did a sharp turn and disappeared. A couple days earlier during the day time I saw a plane doing some real sharp turns with no noise, I dismissed it thinking it was just a stunt plane but the place it appeared was the same as the object I saw at night. I always thought I would be scared out of my mind if I saw a UFO but surprisingly I was excited and wish the it stuck around longer to watch. Being paranoid I checked the time to see if I lost any, thankfully I did not.
